page.title: 11WELLDRESSING AND CARNIVAL
page.content: In its present form the carnival has been taking place since about 1945. A great deal of organisation has to take place before the event. Bands are booked, the queen picked, stalls erected, floats made and refreshments provided. After the parade and her crowning the queen has several duties like presenting prizes and representing Bradwell at other carnivals. Putting on the carnival is expensive as bands have to be paid and refreshments organised. In some years the money collected is not sufficient to cover the costs and a loss is made. During the carnival there are three welldressings in Bradwell. These are part of a old Derbyshire tradition which thanked God for the gift of water.
